title: IP Address Parser
description: Parse and validate IPv4 and IPv6 addresses, supporting various formats including compressed IPv6 notation and IPv4-mapped IPv6 addresses.

motivation.why: IP address parsing is fundamental for network applications, security tools, log analysis, and access control systems. Proper validation prevents security issues from malformed addresses.
useCases: Log file analysis and IP extraction

inputFormat.description: IPv4 addresses use dotted decimal notation (four octets 0-255). IPv6 addresses use eight groups of hexadecimal digits, with :: compression for consecutive zero groups.

outputFormat.description: The parser returns an IpAddress enum distinguishing between IPv4 and IPv6, with optional component extraction for IPv4 octets.

type.description: IpAddress enum with variants: Ipv4(String), Ipv6(String)

Ipv6.description: Can be decomposed into hex groups
